page.title: 11ASHDON RICKETTS/NEWNHAM HALL
page.content: The{largest farm}in the area is owned by Mr.E.H.Vestey.This is not typical of other farms in Ashdon,for more than half the total acreage is devoted to pasture and woodland.At Ricketts Farm there are currently 800 breeding ewes including Pedigree Suffolk,Scotch half breeds and a few "mules".In addition there are 28 Suffolk rams,10 Suffolk ram lambs and 33 Suffolk gimmer lambs (young sheep that have lambed only once).This spring 1217 lambs were born and there are 900 at the moment ,the rest having been sold. At Newnham Hall Farm there is a dairy herd of 120 Red Friesian cows plus 90 followers.The estate consists of 397 acres of arable land,342 acres of pasture (including 100 acres for silage)and 92 acres of woodland .There are over 20 horses(not working).
